subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Yin and Yang: Balance in Everything
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Yin and Yang: Balance in Everything.

hook.text: Light needs dark. Hot needs cold. Life needs death. Yin and yang isn't about balance â€” it's about interdependence.

buildup.text: Yin represents the passive, dark, feminine force. Yang represents the active, light, masculine. Neither exists alone.

discovery.text: The famous symbol shows each half containing a dot of the other. Opposition always contains its opposite within.

twist.text: Yin and yang shaped Chinese medicine, martial arts, feng shui, and cooking. It's a worldview, not just a symbol.

climax.text: Western thinking loves either/or. Eastern thinking embraces both/and. Yin and yang is the universe's operating system.

punchline.text: Light holds dark. Dark holds light. Yin and yang is reality's code.

quiz.question: What does the yin-yang symbol represent?
